com.google.api.services.qpxExpress

Class QPXExpressRequestInitializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.api.client.googleapis.services.CommonGoogleClientRequestInitializer
      • com.google.api.client.googleapis.services.json.CommonGoogleJsonClientRequestInitializer
        • com.google.api.services.qpxExpress.QPXExpressRequestInitializer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.api.client.googleapis.services.GoogleClientRequestInitializer

    public class QPXExpressRequestInitializer
extends com.google.api.client.googleapis.services.json.CommonGoogleJsonClientRequestInitializer
    QPXExpress request initializer for setting properties like key and userIp.

    The simplest usage is to use it to set the key parameter: 

      public static final GoogleClientRequestInitializer KEY_INITIALIZER =
      new QPXExpressRequestInitializer(KEY);

    There is also a constructor to set both the key and userIp parameters: 

      public static final GoogleClientRequestInitializer INITIALIZER =
      new QPXExpressRequestInitializer(KEY, USER_IP);

    If you want to implement custom logic, extend it like this: 

      public static class MyRequestInitializer extends QPXExpressRequestInitializer {

    @Override
    public void initializeQPXExpressRequest(QPXExpressRequest<?> request)
        throws IOException {
      // custom logic
    }
  }

    Finally, to set the key and userIp parameters and insert custom logic, extend it like this: 

      public static class MyRequestInitializer2 extends QPXExpressRequestInitializer {

    public MyKeyRequestInitializer() {
      super(KEY, USER_IP);
    }

    @Override
    public void initializeQPXExpressRequest(QPXExpressRequest<?> request)
        throws IOException {
      // custom logic
    }
  }

    Subclasses should be thread-safe.

    Since:
    1.12
